Small Business Relief - SBR Filing.description: Assessment for Small Business Relief Eligibility (AED 3 million threshold)
Small Business Relief - SBR Filing.methodology:
CALCULATION METHODOLOGY:
1. Gross Receipts Basis (NOT net income or profits)
2. Include: Regular revenue + Asset sales + Out-of-scope/Exempt VAT transactions + Dividends from shareholdings
3. Important: Revenue from VAT returns must match; if not, add exempt/out-of-scope amounts
4. All bank receipts must align with reported revenue
5. Threshold: AED 3,000,000 total gross receipts

questions.question: What is your total revenue/turnover for the tax period (AED)?
Do you have any asset sales in the tax period? If yes, what is the sale amount (AED)?
Does your revenue figure match the VAT return revenues?
If revenue doesn't match VAT, what is the total amount of exempt/out-of-scope transactions (AED)?
Is the company a shareholder in another company locally or internationally?
Did you receive any dividends? If yes, what is the amount (AED)?
Do your receipts in all bank accounts align with the reported revenue?
Did you make profits in excess of AED 375,000, or are you in losses?
If you are in losses, do you plan to carry forward tax losses for future tax benefits?
Is the company part of any unincorporated partnerships?
Is the company a tax resident in another country?
Does the company have any property, intangible assets, or financial assets purchased before the corporate tax period?
Do you have any assets valued using fair value method in financial statements?

Transitional Tax Benefits - Property.description: Transitional relief calculations for real estate assets
Transitional Tax Benefits - Property.methodology:
CALCULATION METHODOLOGY:
1. WITH TITLE DEED: Straightforward calculation - compare market value method vs time apportionment
2. OFF-PLAN PROPERTY: 
   - Check control: If user has control (can use/lease/sell), capitalize under IAS 40
   - Oqood (approved contract) = control if economic rewards can be achieved through sale
3. CALCULATIONS REQUIRED:
   - Market Value Method: Use FMV on first day of tax period
   - Time Apportionment Method: (Days held pre-tax / Total days held) × Gain
4. Note: Tax savings for unsold units cannot use time apportionment (only on sale date)
5. Provide comparison and recommend best method

questions.question: Do you own property under the company name purchased before your first corporate tax period?
When did you purchase? (Date of Oqood / Property Title Deed)
Is the property ready or off-plan? If under construction, do you have title deed or direct access?
Are you still holding the property, or has it been sold?
If sold, please provide the sale date and selling price (AED):
How was the property accounted for in the books?
What was the market value of the property on the first day of the tax period (AED)?
Are you able to provide a valuation certificate at this value?
What was the original purchase price including all directly attributable costs (registration, trustee fees, commissions) (AED)?
What's the selling price if the property is sold (AED)?

Transitional Tax Benefits - Intangible A.description: Transitional relief for intangible assets (same methodology as property, no control issues)
Transitional Tax Benefits - Intangible A.methodology:
CALCULATION METHODOLOGY:
Same as property transitional rules EXCEPT control issue doesn't apply.
1. Compare Market Value Method vs Time Apportionment Method
2. Market Value Method: FMV on first day of tax period
3. Time Apportionment: (Days held pre-tax / Total days held) × Gain
4. Recommend optimal method based on calculations

questions.question: Do you own intangible assets under company name purchased before first corporate tax period?
If yes, provide the purchase date:
Are you still holding the intangible assets, or have they been sold?
If sold, provide the date:
How were intangible assets accounted for in the books?
What was the market value of intangible assets on first day of tax period (AED)?
Are you able to reliably measure the value or provide a valuation certificate?
What was the original purchase price including all directly attributable costs (AED)?
What's the selling price if sold (AED)?

Transitional Tax Benefits - Financial As.methodology:
CALCULATION METHODOLOGY:
Same as Intangible Assets - control issues don't apply.
1. Compare Market Value Method vs Time Apportionment Method
2. Calculate tax savings under both methods
3. Provide recommendation on optimal method

questions.question: Do you own financial assets under company name purchased before first corporate tax period?
If yes, provide the date:
Are you still holding financial assets, or have they been sold?
If sold, provide the date:
How were financial assets accounted for in the books?
What was the market value of financial assets on first day of tax period (AED)?
Are you able to reliably measure the value or provide a valuation certificate?
What was the original purchase price including all directly attributable costs (AED)?
What's the selling price if the asset is sold (AED)?

Connected Person Payments.description: Payments to owners, shareholders, directors, relatives
Connected Person Payments.methodology:
CALCULATION METHODOLOGY:
1. Identify ALL payments to connected parties (shareholders, directors, officers, partners, relatives)
2. Calculate EXCESS AMOUNT: Actual payment - Market rate (arm's length)
3. IMPLICATIONS:
   - Excess amounts are NOT tax deductible
   - May trigger transfer pricing documentation requirements
   - Subject to additional scrutiny by FTA
4. ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
   - If total payments > AED 500,000: Enhanced disclosure required
   - Need contracts/agreements supporting payment terms
   - Justification for any excess (special skills, risks, expertise)
   - Must demonstrate arm's length principle
5. Consider: Salaries, commissions, benefits, non-monetary benefits

questions.question: Were there any payments, benefits, or transactions to shareholders, directors, officers, partners, or related parties?
What was the total amount of these payments (AED)?
What would the payment have been if made to an unconnected party with similar role, responsibility, risk profile, and expertise (AED)?
If actual payment differs from market rate, why is there a difference?
Does the total payment to connected parties exceed AED 500,000 for the Tax Period?
Was this payment recurring, and did it start before Corporate Tax became applicable?
Are there contracts or agreements supporting the payment terms to the connected party?
Were there any non-monetary benefits provided to connected parties?
If yes, describe and estimate value of non-monetary benefits:

Related Party Transactions.description: Transfer pricing and related party transaction assessment

questions.question: Is there any transaction with a person, family member, or company that owns, controls, or significantly influences 50% or more of your business?
Is there any transaction with another business commonly owned or controlled by the same person or group?
What types of transactions do you have with related parties?
How were the prices or charges for these transactions determined?
Would the price be the same if the transaction was with an independent party?
If different, what special skills, risks, or benefits justify the difference?
Do you have agreements, contracts, or board approvals supporting related party transactions?
Is the total value of all transactions with related parties during the year less than AED 40 million?
Does any single type of related party transaction exceed AED 4 million?
Is the company part of a multinational group with global revenues above AED 3.15 billion, or does the company itself have annual revenues above AED 200 million?

Real Estate.description: Real estate investment and taxation assessment
Real Estate.methodology:
CRITICAL NOTES:
1. Real estate investment income of INDIVIDUALS is NOT taxable in UAE (clearly stated in rules)
2. Must refer to datasets and provide specific, accurate answers (not generic ChatGPT responses)
3. Consider: Property type, ownership structure, business activity, accounting treatment

questions.question: Who owns the property?
If it's an individual, what is the nationality of the owner?
What's the nature of the property?
What's the licensed activity of the Company?
Is the company intending to buy and sell in the short term, or hold for rentals and long-term appreciation?
Do you have the Title of the property, or is it still under SPA / Oqood?
When did you purchase? (Date of Oqood / Property Title Deed)
Do you already have books of accounts prepared?
What's the concern you would like to address?
Do you have any document to upload for analysis?

Qualifying Freezone Persons (QFZP).description: Assessment for Qualifying Free Zone Person status (0% tax rate eligibility)

questions.question: Is your company registered in a freezone?
Provide total revenue for the tax period (AED):
Income from transactions with natural persons (except aircraft leasing, ship operations, fund management, wealth management) - Amount (AED) and %:
Income from banking activities - Amount (AED) and %:
Income from insurance activities (excluding reinsurance or captive insurance) - Amount (AED) and %:
Income from financial and leasing activities (except ships, aircraft, treasury, and related party financing) - Amount (AED) and %:
Income from immovable property other than commercial property in freezone - Amount (AED) and %:
Income from qualifying activities with mainland/international clients:
Provide total income from above qualifying activities (AED):
How much of your income (amount and %) is with other freezone persons?
If you outsource any activity, is it to freezone persons and do you supervise that work?
Are your core income generating activities and key decisions carried out in the freezone?
Do you incur expenses in the company that are as per usual benchmark in the same industry?
Do you have real operations in the freezone? (e.g., space, adequate staff to run your activities)

Tax Residency Certificate - Companies.description: Eligibility assessment for UAE Tax Residency Certificate for Companies

questions.question: Is your company incorporated or legally registered in the UAE?
Is the place of effective management of the company in the UAE (i.e., key management and commercial decisions are made in the UAE)?
Does your company maintain proper books and records in the UAE?
Has your company filed UAE Corporate Tax returns (if applicable) and complied with other tax obligations?

Tax Residency Certificate - Individuals.description: Eligibility assessment for UAE Tax Residency Certificate for Individuals

questions.question: Is your usual home and main financial/personal interests located in the UAE?
Do you own or rent a home in the UAE?
Are your main family members (spouse, children, dependents) living in the UAE?
Do you have bank accounts, investments, or other financial assets in the UAE?
Is your primary source of income derived from employment or business activities in the UAE?
Are your personal and professional documents (ID, driver's license, health insurance, etc.) registered in the UAE?
Do you spend the majority of your free time in the UAE compared to other countries?
Are your legal or financial obligations (taxes, loans, insurance) mainly in the UAE?
Do you have any significant tax residency in another country that may conflict with UAE residency?
How many days have you been in the UAE in the last 12 months?
If less than 183 days, do you meet the 90-day rule criteria? (UAE/GCC nationality OR UAE Resident Permit AND permanent residence OR employment/business in UAE)

Designated Freezone Transactions.description: VAT treatment for Designated Free Zone transactions

questions.question: Do you provide services from the Designated Zone to customers in the mainland or abroad?
Do you receive services from mainland or foreign suppliers while in the Designated Zone?
Have you had any lost, missing, or unaccounted-for goods in the Designated Zone?
When selling to mainland, is the buyer a VAT-registered business (B2B) or an individual consumer (B2C)?
Do you sell or move goods from the Designated Zone to the UAE mainland?
Do you purchase goods from the UAE mainland into the Designated Zone?
Do you import goods from abroad directly into the Designated Zone?
When transferring, do the goods remain under customs suspension and not altered?
Do you transfer goods between two different Designated Zones?
Are any of those goods consumed, used, or written off inside the zone?

Profit Margin Scheme (Used Goods Sales V.description: VAT Profit Margin Scheme for used goods, antiques, collectibles

questions.question: What type of goods are you selling?
From whom did you purchase these goods?
Did you claim input VAT on the purchase of these goods?
Does the purchase invoice you received show VAT separately?
Have you included any additional costs (like transport, commission, or repairs) in the purchase price of these goods?
Do you keep a record or stock ledger of each item purchased and sold under Profit Margin Scheme?
When you issue invoices to customers, do you include the wording 'Tax charged with reference to the profit margin'?
Is your selling price lower than your purchase cost (making a loss)?

Voluntary Disclosures (VDS) - VAT.description: Voluntary disclosure for VAT errors or underpayments

questions.question: Did you discover any error in your VAT return or refund application that needs correction?
Has this type of error happened before (first time or repeated)?
Is the voluntary disclosure already submitted?
When did the error occur?
How much is the underpaid / overpaid VAT amount (AED)?
Are you prepared to settle the underpaid VAT within 20 business days to avoid late payment interest?

Voluntary Disclosures (VDS) - Corporate.description: Voluntary disclosure for Corporate Tax errors or underpayments

questions.question: Did you discover any mistake or underpayment in your Corporate Tax return?
When was the original tax return due, and how long ago was it filed?
What is the underpaid Corporate Tax amount (Tax Difference) (AED)?
Did you submit a Voluntary Disclosure yet, or is it still pending?
